newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Paranagua says expects sporadic loading.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Paranagua says expects sporadic loading.

text.p: The key Brazilian port of Paranagua said it expected loading of grains to continue sporadically at its export terminal today insofar as rains allow.
Loading has been temporarily suspended because of the bad weather but should resume as soon as showers stop. The terminal stopped loading grains at 0750 local/1050 GMT.
"At the moment loading has stopped," said an official at the export terminal. "But we should be loading in dribs and drabs."
"The terminal is not 100 percent paralyzed," a spokeswoman said, adding that operations would continue erratically during the day.
The National Institute of Meteorology said the region should be sunny again by Wednesday.
